intro: Lagenophora billardierei var. microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed lagenophora, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and pinkish-white flowers. The species is typically found in sandy soils in coastal areas, thriving in well-drained environments. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The plant is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
